file_content.text: Your part here is over.
You summoned me?
You walk among Voss. You are not Voss. You share tea with low-born families and Mystics.
Your arrival burned the Chamber of Ashes. A prophecy speaks of these things.
The one prophesized must be brought before the Three. Given attention and honest aid.
Do you believe in prophecy, outsider?
In my time here, I've learned to trust your ways.
I accept the Voss teachings.
You are wise.
I'm not a Sith or a Jedi, and I'm certainly not Voss. It's not my place to say.
That's not for me to judge.
The Mystics have power. That doesn't make them infallible.
Let's just say I'm skeptical.
Interpretation is a delicate art.
The prophecy that fits you fit the Shining Man. Perhaps both were prophesied. Perhaps one is false.
We aid you as we aided him. If one is false, this meeting insures destiny.
I think I understand. What did you meet with him about?
The Shining Man met with you?
You're worried you helped the wrong man. I'm your insurance.
You're hedging your bets.
The Three are practical.
The Shining Man wanted to fool you. He counted on your belief in prophecy.
He was false. I'm for real.
His intentions change nothing.
The Shining Man told us the secrets of your galaxy. He proposed we make no alliance with outsiders for three thousand days.
In return, he promised the Gormak will be eliminated.
He promised our world will be free from outsiders; no new ships will enter our system.
He promised the Republic and the Empire will cease to exist. We promised the Shining Man to ally with none.
All this time, we've been trying to win you over... and you were allied with the conspirators.
That's why you're neutral...
For three thousand days. We were offered much for little.
You're talking about reshaping the galaxy in... what, a few years?
How could he possibly do that?
We need only wait. We will see if promises are fulfilled.
The Shining Man can't do any of that. No one can do that.
This is insane.
Believe what you will.
If the Shining Man's masters are prophesied to succeed, your insight changes nothing. If you are prophesied to succeed, our part is finished.
You may go. Act as you wish.
You owe me more than that. I fulfilled your prophecy; I want your help.
I have a request, first.
What do you wish?
You know that I married a Voss. I want my family taken care of while I'm gone.
Help Bas-Ton's family.
There's a man named Therod-Ton who committed a crime. Spare him, please.
Help Bas-Ton's family.
There's a man named Karrels Javis. His son is crippled, and he needs a healer. If you could talk to the Mystics....
Help Karrels Javis.
We will do this kindness.
When your period of neutrality is over, join with the Empire. We can be partners.
Consider an Imperial alliance.
Perhaps. Your words are valued.
Whatever you can give me--weapons, supplies, credits.
I want resources for myself.
It will be arranged.
This prophecy about the Nightmare Lands, the one we both fulfilled--the Shining Man faked it.
Listen--the prophecy is a lie.
The scroll was examined. We have no doubts.
I'm supposed to just walk away? Knowing what I know?
You can't just dismiss me!
Your time on Voss is over. Your battle is elsewhere.
"In the shrine, you were healed. In Voss-Ka, you found family. You came to us broken and leave remade."
"In the shrine, you did violence. In Voss-Ka, you found family. You came to us broken and leave unfinished; what will you become?"
A Mystic asked that I speak those words and give you this. Remember our people.
Do not forget what you have seen. You have begun a terrible path here.
You have no place before the Three.
